intro: Silene inconspicua, commonly known as the inconspicuous campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Silene inconspicua is often found in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
